016package de.cuioss.tools.lang;
017
018import static de.cuioss.tools.string.MoreStrings.isEmpty;
019
020import java.lang.reflect.AccessibleObject;
021import java.lang.reflect.Constructor;
022import java.security.AccessController;
023import java.security.PrivilegedAction;
024import java.util.Map;
025import java.util.Optional;
026import java.util.Properties;
027
028import lombok.experimental.UtilityClass;
029
030/**
031 * Helper class providing some convenience method for interacting with
032 * {@link SecurityManager} related stuff. In essence, it uses
033 * {@link AccessController#doPrivileged(PrivilegedAction)} for its method in
034 * case a {@link SecurityManager} is set.
035 *
036 * @deprecated SecurityManager hard deprecated by Java 18+
037 * @author Oliver Wolff
038 *
039 */
040@UtilityClass
041@SuppressWarnings("java:S1905") // owolff: The casts are necessary for the return type
042@Deprecated(forRemoval = true, since = "1.2")
043public class SecuritySupport {
044
045    /**
046     * @return the context-classloader if obtainable, {@link Optional#empty()}
047     *         otherwise
048     */
049    public static Optional<ClassLoader> getContextClassLoader() {
050        return Optional.ofNullable(Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader());
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * @param object     to be set accessible
055     * @param accessible value
056     */
057    public static void setAccessible(AccessibleObject object, boolean accessible) {
058        object.setAccessible(accessible);
059    }
060
061    /**
062     * @param propertyName If is null or empty the method will return
063     *                     {@link Optional#empty()}
064     * @return an {@link Optional} on the requested property
065     */
066    public static Optional<String> accessSystemProperty(String propertyName) {
067        if (isEmpty(propertyName)) {
068            return Optional.empty();
069        }
070        return Optional.ofNullable(System.getProperty(propertyName));
071    }
072
073    /**
074     * @return the {@link Properties} derived by {@link System#getProperties()}. If
075     *         this can not be achieved it returns an empty {@link Properties}
076     *         object.
077     */
078    public static Properties accessSystemProperties() {
079        return System.getProperties();
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * @return the map derived by {@link System#getenv()}. If this can not be
084     *         achieved it returns an empty map.
085     */
086    public static Map<String, String> accessSystemEnv() {
087        return System.getenv();
088    }
089
090    /**
091     * @param <T>
092     * @param clazz      The type of the object
093     * @param paramTypes to be used for identifying the constructor
094     * @return the found constructor.
095     * @throws NoSuchMethodException to be thrown, if there is no corresponding
096     *                               constructor
097     * @throws IllegalStateException for cases where the {@link PrivilegedAction}
098     *                               fails but is not a
099     *                               {@link NoSuchMethodException}
100     */
101    @SuppressWarnings("squid:S1452") // owolff: using wildcards here is the only sensible thing to
102                                     // do
103    public static <T> Constructor<? extends T> getDeclaredConstructor(Class<T> clazz, Class<?>... paramTypes)
104            throws NoSuchMethodException {
105        return clazz.getDeclaredConstructor(paramTypes);
106    }
107}
